bill_title: to revise the requirements relating to the use of child restraint systems in passenger vehicles.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the requirements relating to the use of child restraint systems in passenger vehicles. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-37-1 be amended to read as follows: 32-37-1. Any operator of any passenger vehicle transporting a child under five eighteen years of age on the streets and highways of this state shall properly secure the child in a child passenger restraint or seat belt system . The requirements of this section are met if: (1) A child who is under the age of five is properly secured in a child passenger restraint system according to its manufacturer's instructions. The child passenger restraint system shall meet Department of Transportation Motor Vehicle Safety Standard 213 as in effect January 1, 1984. The requirements of this section are met if the 1981; or (2) A child who is at least two five and under five eighteen years of age by securing the child is properly secured in a child passenger restraint or seat belt system . An operator who violates this section commits a petty offense. Section 2. That § 32-37-2 be amended to read as follows: 32-37-2. The provisions of § 32-37-1 do not apply: (1) To drivers licensed in another state or jurisdiction; (2) If the child's personal needs are being attended to by someone other than the driver; (3) If all seating positions equipped with child passenger restraint systems or seat belts are occupied; or (4) (2) In passenger cars manufactured before 1966 that have not been equipped with seat belts.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the requirements relating to the use of child restraint systems in passenger vehicles. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-37-1 be amended to read as follows: 32-37-1. Any operator of any passenger vehicle transporting a child under five eighteen years of age on the streets and highways of this state shall properly secure the child in a child passenger restraint or seat belt system . The requirements of this section are met if: (1) A child who is under the age of five is properly secured in a child passenger restraint system according to its manufacturer's instructions. The child passenger restraint system shall meet Department of Transportation Motor Vehicle Safety Standard 213 as in effect January 1, 1984. The requirements of this section are met if the 1981; or (2) A child who is at least two five and under five eighteen years of age by securing the child is properly secured in a child passenger restraint or seat belt system . An operator who violates this section commits a petty offense. Enforcement of subdivision (2) of this section by state or local law enforcement agencies shall be accomplished as a secondary action. Section 2. That § 32-37-2 be amended to read as follows: 32-37-2. The provisions of § 32-37-1 do not apply: (1) To drivers licensed in another state or jurisdiction; (2) If the child's personal needs are being attended to by someone other than the driver; (3) If all seating positions equipped with child passenger restraint systems or seat belts are occupied; or (4) (2) In passenger cars manufactured before 1966 September 1, 1973, that have not been equipped with seat belts. BILL HISTORY 1/13/98 First read in Senate and referred to Transportation. S.J. 33 1/20/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/22/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/22/98 Transportation Deferred to another day, AYES 4, NAYS 3. 1/27/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/27/98 Transportation Do Pass Amended, Failed, AYES 3, NAYS 4. 1/27/98 Deferred to 36th legislative day, AYES 4, NAYS 3. S.J. 212 1/29/98 Recalled from committee (Rule 7-7). S.J. 242 1/29/98 Transportation Do Pass, Failed, AYES 3, NAYS 4. 1/29/98 Transportation Do not Pass, AYES 5, NAYS 2. S.J. 259 2/2/98 Motion to strike the "not" Passed, AYES 21, NAYS 13.
